page.title: 04LIVE STOCK (SHEEP)
page.content:
Most sheep farmers in the area have on average 200 sheep,some share lambs and some for breeding.The farmers do not shear the lambs the first year of their lives. Shearing time is in June. After shearing the sheep,the wool is sent to the wollen mills at Bradford. Share lambs are sent to market after they have been fattened up,some farmers growing turnips especially for fattening up the lambs (The fattened up lambs are sold for Â£40 in the local market at Darlington).The breeding lambs are{Swaledale, Border, Leicester and {Masham}breeding ewes which are fed on mainly grass, hay, rolled barley and oats. Most farmers grow their own crops although some do buy them in.
